solution_line_template: First, we need to determine the total amount of minutes available for cooking. We do this by performing {hours_available}*{minutes_per_hour}=<<{hours_available}*{minutes_per_hour}={total_minutes_available}>>{total_minutes_available}, as there are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in an hour.

Now that we know we have {total_minutes_available} minutes, we then divide the preparation time into the total amount of time by performing {total_minutes_available}/{prep_time_per_dish}= <<{total_minutes_available}/{prep_time_per_dish}={num_dishes_made}>>{num_dishes_made} dishes capable of being made.

Since each dish can feed {people_per_dish} people, we find the total number of people fed by performing {people_per_dish}*{num_dishes_made}=<<{people_per_dish}*{num_dishes_made}={total_people_fed}>>{total_people_fed} people.
